name: generateBCryptHash
description: It is a password-hashing cryptographic function that takes an input and hashes it into a fixed size output./nNOTE: BCrypt input is limited to 72 bytes.

params.name: options
params.description:
A struct containing the optional values:
--version - Version of BCrypt hash to generate ($2a,$2y or $2b). (Default is "$2a". The most current version is "$2b")
--rounds - Number of rounds to run the hash functions. (Default is 10.)

examples.title: Example of BCrypt Hashing - No Options
examples.description: This is an example of using the function with no options.
examples.code: secretMsg=generateBCryptHash("My voice is my passport. Verify me.");writeDump(secretMsg)

examples.title: Example of BCrypt Hashing - With Version Option
examples.description: This is an example of using the function with optional version specified.
examples.code:
secretMsg=generateBCryptHash("My voice is my passport. Verify me.",{"version":"$2b"});
writeDump(secretMsg)
